item.title: Install Linux With Pen Drive
item.description: Note: I would recommend you use the unetbootin to make the Linux bootable USB drive, since it is more easier (GUI) and convinience (auto-download distribution CD, auto-make boot flags). The below process just reach the same target, helping you understand what happened during the unetbootin process. In the very beginning, I thought it was really difficult to install a linux from a USB, since it requires GRUB, kinds of alternative CD media, and a “special” cd boot vmlinuz and initrd.
